text: Where does Jon Stuart Mill from?

text: Which American President wrote an essay on public administration?
explanation: In the 19th Century, public administration began to take shape as a distinct discipline, particularly marked by Woodrow Wilson’s influential essay “The Study of Public Administration” in 1887. Wilson’s essay advocated for the Politics-Administration dichotomy, emphasizing the importance of making public administration an instrument dedicated to serving the public interest and facilitating the delivery of public services.

text: Which of the following is the consequence of the Rearrangement Law No. 6360 enacted in 2012 with the application of the geographical boundaries of the metropolitan municipalities in the 30 provinces and the provincial borders became the same?

options.A:
Thousands of urbans have become villages and neighborhoods within
the 6360 Law legal rearrangement framework.
options.B:
One of village has become urban neighborhoods within
the 6360 Law legal rearrangement framework.
options.C: Special provincial administrations in these regions continued to work.
options.D: Thousands of special provincial administrations have become urban neighborhoods within the 6360 Law legal rearrangement framework.
options.E:
Thousands of villages have become urban neighborhoods within
the 6360 Law legal rearrangement framework.

explanation:
In the example of Türkiye, the provisions
of the Rearrangement Law No. 6360 enacted
in 2012 and the secondary regulations enacted
afterward increased the number of metropolitan
municipalities from 16 to 30. The geographical
boundaries of the metropolitan municipalities
in these 30 provinces and the provincial borders
became the same. Special provincial administrations
in these areas have been abolished. Thousands of
villages have become urban neighborhoods within
the same legal rearrangement framework.

text: Which of the following is an example of a Generation 1 type of digital local governance service channels/standards?
explanation: The standard for digital local public service provision is continuously evolving in parallel with technological changes. In the 1990s, digital local governance via a local government website became the norm and it is known as the Generation 1 type.

text: Which is an example of the latest generation of digital local governance service channels/standards?
explanation: In the 2020s, new and emerging technologies, such as the metaverse and artificial intelligence applications, are increasingly used by local government units, and this trend resembles the latest generation is use.

text: Which of the following aspects of digital local governance enhances trust among citizens?
explanation: One of the benefits of digital local governance practices is enhancing transparency and accountability. When the users of online government information and services access government data, documentation, and how and by whom the decisions in government are being taken, it is more likely that the trust between the local government and the other actors of the local governance ecosystem.

text: Which of the following is not among the risk associated with digital local governance?

options.C: Heightening the concerns for personal data privacy
options.E: Decreasing existing gaps in digital literacy

explanation: Digital local governance practices are exacerbating existing gaps in digital literacy. Without properly identifying these gaps, providing training in digital literacy, and implementing support systems, individuals, groups, and communities will struggle to access and benefit from the advantages of local digital governance.

text: Which of the following is unrelated to the possible positive outcomes of the centralized service delivery option?

options.B: One-stop and instant control of electronic governance-related data through data security and privacy processes
options.C: Ensuring similarity of content at the national level
options.D: Preventing the difference in local governance quality and performance between institutions
options.E: Reducing the waste of resources due to the lack of services by setting up separate websites/ platforms

explanation:
Possible positive outcomes of the centralized service delivery option are;
i. Reducing the waste of resources due to the lack of services by setting up separate websites/ platforms,
ii. Preventing the difference in local governance quality and performance between institutions,
iii. Ensuring similarity of content at the national level,
iv. One-stop and instant control of electronic governance-related data through data security and privacy processes and
v. Increasing satisfaction.
